methodology: AB 719 CPUC baseline (2013) x territory-specific population growth (county-deflated ACS 2013->2023)

data_sources.census_tracts: Census TIGERweb ACS2023 tract boundaries (9,129 tracts)
data_sources.population_2013: ACS 2013 5-year (county level, applied proportionally to 2023 tracts)
data_sources.streetlight_baseline: AB 719 Bill Analysis (April 2013), data provided by CPUC
data_sources.utility_owned_counts: Utility press releases and publications (see notes)

notes: Non-retail overlays removed: PWRPA (wholesale), Metropolitan Water District (water), Eastside Power Authority (JPA)
2013 tract population estimated by deflating 2023 tract pop using county-level growth factors
Non-IOU streetlights estimated using IOU lights-per-capita ratio (assumption: similar density)
94 tracts (254K people) unmatched to any utility territory

IMPORTANT: 'lights_2023_est' = total lights in territory (utility + municipal). 'utility_owned' = lights the utility directly owns and operates. Only utility-owned lights are dispatchable for DR without municipal coordination.

ious.utility_owned_source: Lighting the Way for Next-Generation Streetlight Efficiency _ Energized by Edison.pdf
